text:
The text is not written RTL. I am using JDK1.4.1_02. Others have also confirmed 
that the problem occurs on 1.4.1_04. Thomas DeWeese on the mailing list 
indicated that the problem does not occur on JDK1.3.1. 

I am using the command line rasteriser. java -jar batik-rasteriser.jar ...

<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20010904//EN"
   "http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">
<svg width="100" height="100" viewBox="498355 252780 50 50"
      xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
      xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">

<rect x="498355" y="252780" width="50" height="50" fill="white"/>
<path id="t_32" d="M498376,252804 L498399,252818 L498627,253000"
  fill="none" stroke="white"/>
<text>
<textPath xlink:href="#t_32">
<tspan unicode-bidi="bidi-override" direction="rtl">txet</tspan>
</textPath>
</text>
</svg>
creator: chrisf@oramap.com
chrisf@oramap.com
text:
Created attachment 8754
image example of non working text

This is a bug in JDK 1.4.1.
As this is an uncommon case and difficult/expensive to work around
I will file this as LATER.
creator: deweese@apache.org
